Package gov.sandia.gmp.util.io

Interface InputStreamProvider<D>

All Superinterfaces:
Serializable
All Known Subinterfaces:
InputStreamProvider.FileInputStreamProvider
public interface InputStreamProvider<D> extends Serializable
Simple interface that allows for the transformation of different types of objects into InputStreams. This is particularly useful in cases where distributed applications need to stream data from a file system or socket on the application client to task execution nodes.
Author:
Benjamin Lawry (bjlawry@sandia.gov) created on 04/05/2023

  • Method Details

    • newStream

      InputStream newStream(D dataObject) throws IOException
      Creates a new InputStream for the specified data object
      Parameters:
      dataObject -
      Returns:
      InputStream for the data represented by the specified object
      Throws:
      IOException - may occur if a disk read error or network issue occurs during creation of the new stream instance

    • newScanner

      default Scanner newScanner(D dataObject) throws IOException
      Creates a new InputStream and wraps it in a Scanner
      Parameters:
      dataObject -
      Returns:
      Throws:
      IOException

    • buffered

      default InputStreamProvider<D> buffered(int bufLen)
      Creates a new provider, based on this one, that also buffers underlying created streams with the specified buffer length.
      Parameters:
      bufLen - length in bytes (must be greater than 1 to have any effect)
      Returns:
      new InputStreamProvider that buffers created InputStream instances

    • onNewStream

      default InputStreamProvider<D> onNewStream(InputStreamProvider.TriConsumer<D,InputStream,IOException> ioxHandler)
      Allows an outside function to receive notifications whenever newStream is called. If the stream is created successfully, the exception passed to the function will be null and vice versa.
      Parameters:
      ioxHandler - handles the input, output, and exceptions resulting from all calls to newStream()
      Returns:
      new InputStreamProvider instance that forwards all inputs/outputs/exceptions to ioxHandler

    • memoryResident

      default InputStreamProvider<D> memoryResident(int bufLen)
      Returns:
      a stream provider that fully reads the underlying stream into a byte[], then uses that byte[] to fulfill all subsequent calls to "newStream(dataObject)".

    • memoryResident

      default InputStreamProvider<D> memoryResident()
